Joe Bauers.Action: Politely declines volunteering for top secret experiment, citing desire to not risk pension.
Listens to Sergeant Miller's warning about hollow emptiness and struggle with apparent skepticism but remains respectful.
Concentrates intensely while using a soldering iron, attempting a technical task.
Attempts to pop a popcorn kernel with a soldering iron tip, resulting in accidentally shocking himself and falling back.
Declines a top secret experiment opportunity, citing desire to preserve his pension rather than pursue challenge or growth.
Expresses understanding of the emotional consequences of avoiding challenges (hollow feeling), but still rejects challenge.
Expresses preference to keep things as they are rather than take on a responsibility he dislikes.
Expresses reluctance to take on responsibility and prefers to be left alone, avoids challenge.
Acknowledges previous failure when attempting a technical task (rewiring sound system).
Chosen for being extremely average with no family, showing no evident manipulative or selfish traits in the selection context.
Selected for Human Hibernation Project because he is remarkably average in all categories.
Reassures Sharon not to blame herself for missing him before his year-long absence, tries to lighten her worries.
Makes a sincere agreement to meet Sharon exactly one year and three days later, showing commitment and thoughtfulness.
Awkwardly tries to start a conversation with Rita, displaying effort to connect despite his nervousness.
Makes a thoughtful plan to meet his girlfriend at a specific time after one year to maintain relationship despite absence.
Acknowledges the difficulty of his situation and attempts to ease his girlfriend's worries with understanding and reassurance.
Appears nervous and awkward while waiting for medical tests, struggling to start conversation.
Tries to strike up a conversation with Rita despite her apparent disinterest and impatience, showing polite interest in her work as an artist.
Compliments Rita multiple times on her lifestyle and art, expressing envy and admiration sincerely.
Laughs politely at a joke he doesn't understand, maintaining a friendly demeanor.
Attempts to make conversation and show interest in Rita's work, but struggles with small talk and awkwardly admits limited imagination.
Fails to pick up on social cues as Rita clearly tries to end the conversation and seems uninterested, yet Joe continues to press her about her art.
Politely laughs along at a joke he does not understand, showing social politeness even if missing the point.
Puts on a brave face to comfort Rita despite his own unease.
Reassures Rita about the safety of the procedure with uncertain information.
Reassures Rita by expressing confidence that the procedure is safe despite uncertainty, showing an attempt to stay calm and supportive.
Fails to demonstrate clear understanding or knowledge of the procedure, giving vague and uncertain statements ('I think', 'They tested it on dogs...').

Joe does not react noticeably to the huge garbage avalanche or the chaotic environment around him.

Looks around dazed, confused, and disoriented but does not lash out or respond with hostility to Dizz's aggression; instead, he apologizes and tries to clarify the situation.
Completely disoriented, groggy, stumbling and falling when trying to stand up and understand surroundings.
Clutches his head in pain and tries to ask questions about his location, indicating some attempt to comprehend the situation.
Politely asks someone to read the sign for him despite the hostile environment.
Attempts to communicate and navigate a confusing, unfriendly setting without aggression or complaint.
Pleading for help when mocked and chased away, showing vulnerability and persistence.
Shakes his head in dismay observing the hospital billboard and atmosphere, indicating empathy and disapproval of their attitude.
Asks for directions despite the language barrier, attempts to seek help in an unfamiliar and confusing environment.
Runs away quickly after being confronted aggressively, showing caution in an unknown and hostile situation.
Notices the hospital sign despite misspellings and bizarre advertising, using visual cues to orient himself.
Walks towards the hospital entrance calmly despite chaos and strange surroundings.
Speaks clearly to the counter woman explaining his situation even though the counter woman is indifferent and the environment is confusing.
Politely asks if there is a drinking fountain after being dismissed.
Politely requests regular water instead of the strange greenish drink, despite confusion around him.
Attempts to communicate his condition clearly to the Counter Woman and asks practical questions like if there is a drinking fountain.
Does not immediately recognize that the drinking fountain dispenses an unfamiliar, suspicious liquid and reacts with confusion.
Approaches a doctor to inquire about obtaining regular water despite confusion and unfamiliarity, showing persistence.
Accepts the confusing situation (a Gatorade-like liquid at a drinking fountain) initially without obvious skepticism.
Fails to anticipate or understand the social context leading to the doctor laughing and dismissing his request.
Complies reluctantly with an embarrassing medical procedure despite discomfort and an impatient crowd.
Reluctantly but correctly follows technician's instructions to insert probes for diagnostic test despite embarrassment and hesitation.
Tries to track which probe was used in which orifice after the technician shuffles them, but fails to do so effectively.
Hesitates and shows discomfort during the procedure, but still complies efficiently to avoid slowing down the line.
Notices the date on the magazine and comments on it as a weird misprint.
Reads articles critically about economy, inflation, dust storms, poverty.
Expresses concern about hallucinating and requests help to get well enough to return to base.
Asks for a second opinion after the doctor insults his condition and communicates poorly.
Decides to go to another hospital when dissatisfied with the first.
Is surprised by the six billion dollar invoice without questioning or challenging it further.
Freaks out upon discovering no one he knows is alive and the future is dramatically different; expresses distress about standing up Sharon.
Notices the same misprint on multiple documents and quickly connects the dots about the date being in the distant future.
Tries to explain the situation calmly ('Wait a minute! You don't understand!') despite the panic.
Realizes the gravity of the situation (everyone he knows is dead).
Starts freaking out and runs out of the building, showing emotional overwhelm rather than composed problem-solving.
Sits alone in a theater horrified by the violent, crude entertainment around him.
Begs away from violent wrestling in a cathedral setting, showing discomfort with aggression.
Simply observes society’s debased behavior without mocking or ridiculing, indicating tolerance and bewildered sincerity.
Stares bewildered and horrified at the devolution of society and its entertainment choices, showing confusion and lack of understanding of the context.

Notices the Golden Arches vending machine and walks over to investigate, showing curiosity and some initiative.
Watches the starving woman and her children run off, showing concern.
Does not intervene or help the woman and children before being tackled by cops.
Watches the woman and her children run off, concerned about their welfare.
Allows himself to be tackled and handcuffed by cops without resistance or any attempt to explain himself.
Attempts to explain his situation to police, shows concern for Rita by recognizing her empty pod and expressing intent to find her.
Snaps at the malfunctioning police car computer voice out of frustration and pain.
Struggles against handcuffs and attempts to explain his situation to the cops.
Notices Rita's empty pod and decides he needs to find her, showing awareness of surroundings and priorities.
Snaps and yells at the malfunctioning police car computer after repeated errors and prompting.
Starts to thrash around as the car pulls away.
Endures public humiliation quietly in a hostile courtroom without retaliation.
Sits passively in a cage during a chaotic courtroom scene, does not respond effectively to hostility.
Clearly frustrated but tries to explain his innocence and suggests taking people to his house to prove it
Expresses exasperation but insists on testifying to explain himself and provide evidence (the pod) to prove innocence.
Surprised and confused that Dizz, a disheveled person he barely knows, is his court-appointed lawyer.
Fails to seem aware of the seriousness and absurdity of the trial process and the competence of those around him.
Tries to explain himself politely when the crowd boos and shouts at him.
Whispers encouragement to Dizz to intervene on his behalf.
Defends himself against accusations firmly but without malice ('Don't say I stole! You're lawyer!').
Stands calmly while the crowd throws junk at him.
Tries to speak calmly and explain himself in court despite ridicule and heckling.
Shows misery and frustration when judged unfairly and humiliated by the crowd and judge.

Does not react aggressively or insultingly to the machine or guards despite being wrongfully restrained and misidentified.
Tries to yank his arm out of tattooing machine in panic and screams in pain.
Asks the cop what the aptitude test is for, showing curiosity and trying to understand.
Tries to yank his arm out of a machine but it won't budge; panics and screams while being tattooed forcibly.
Asks the cop why he must take aptitude and IQ tests, showing some questioning attitude.
Sits and attempts to answer a simple aptitude test question thoughtfully, saying 'Two?' when asked how many buckets there are.

Looks panicked and terrified but tries to explain his situation politely to the guard.
Admits to being a 'big dumbass' in response to the guard's insult, showing humility.
Gets panicked and scared when confronted with a threatening situation in prison.
Attempts to talk to the guard and claims he is getting out of prison today, showing some presence of mind and willingness to take a risk.
Admits he is a 'big dumbass' to the guard, showing low confidence and submissiveness.

Seeks help and tries to reason with Dizz, showing social initiative.

Recognizes his hope for a time machine is unrealistic and shows disappointment.

Appears stumped and unsure when reminded of his jail situation and lack of money.

Attempts to explain financial concepts to Dizz kindly and patiently, despite her confusion.
Sees an opportunity to exaggerate numbers to get Dizz interested in helping him.

Questions the validity of futuristic money, showing awareness of economic changes.
Admits lack of knowledge about what happened to the future society and expresses sadness without proposing solutions.
Attempts to explain the limitations of the time machine to Rita.
Fails to fully assert control or challenge Rita's plan despite potential dangers.
Tries to blend in with companions and helps hide from authorities.
Tries to pull back his hand to avoid being scanned, showing cautiousness.

Decides to abandon the disabled car and run into a nightclub to escape detection.
Runs with friends to escape police violence, remains cooperative and alert despite exhaustion.
Makes light, friendly comment about wanting a Starbucks and being groggy after sleep.
Shows no signs of aggression or selfishness during chaotic violence, prioritizes group safety.
Runs for his life with Rita and Dizz to escape armed police violence, successfully putting distance between themselves and danger.
Leans against a pillar rubbing his head and squinting, showing physical and mental fatigue after prolonged hardships.

Tries to avoid detection by instructing Dizz to pay and whispers instructions, showing protective behavior toward himself and companion.

Expresses concern about how much further they have to go by asking Dizz, indicating situational awareness and a practical mindset.

Responds neutrally to Dizz's crude comments about sex.

Attempts to reason with Rita about the situation, indicating some attempt to understand and communicate.

Looks disturbed at Dizz's behavior, but mainly just observes rather than intervenes effectively before it escalates.

Desperately calls out to Rita, showing concern and focus despite the situation.

Apologizes repeatedly and expresses that he does not want the job.

Openly admits he does not understand the situation and expresses sincere confusion and helplessness.

Leans in and asks Dizz sincerely for help, expressing his own uncertainty and need, showing trust and friendliness.
Stops Dizz from behaving vulgarly and encourages him to act smart, attempting to protect Dizz’s reputation and showing care.
Responds honestly that he has not solved all the problems yet and explains he just arrived and has been confined to his room.

Makes a somewhat intrusive and awkward comment about couples counseling and art managers.

Uses straightforward language without condescension when talking to others.
Expresses frustration with ongoing issue but stays solution-focused, showing responsibility.

Attempts to prove a point by seeking reliable information in the library.
Expresses disbelief and frustration at the poor state of the library’s contents.
Mistakenly accepts that 'Horny Grandmas' might count as an older book.
Explains the electrolyte/salt problem patiently and tries to convince others to trust his solution despite their skepticism.
Reacts politely and quickly averts his eyes when shown an inappropriate centerfold by the 14-year-old, suppressing a dry-heave instead of mocking or berating.
Pores over several ancient, yellowed, mildewed books to find relevant information.
Identifies the cause of dying plants and dust storms by intelligently relating current problems to historical events (Dust Bowl).

Faces dismissal by others and resorts to urging trust rather than providing further proof, indicating some frustration but maintaining composure.
Adapts to ridicule and distraction (14-Year-Old's behavior) without losing focus on the issue at hand.
Explains patiently to a skeptical child that the plants need time to grow and reassures the group about the solution.

Explains calmly that the plants will start growing but it will take time, showing patience and knowledge about the process.

Shows unease and worry about his pardon and the situation around him.

Acknowledges the visible problem and urgency by warning Rita and attempting to leave.
Is quickly captured by guards and appears powerless to handle the situation effectively.
Pleading that he was only trying to help and explaining it will take time, indicating a lack of confidence or control over the situation.

Seems confused or overwhelmed by situation, fearing a trial and shows hesitation.

Acknowledges his own limitations by saying he is not the smartest guy on Earth.
Uses slightly hesitant language and awkward closing ('your extreme... ness...es'), indicating some discomfort or lack of polish.
Speaks quietly and honestly to Rita during prison visit, sharing his grim situation sincerely.

Admits that intelligence may not help in purely physical or dangerous survival situations like being run over by a giant truck.

Gains a little confidence and allows himself a grin after a successful maneuver.
Frantically tries to restart his car to get out of danger, showing determination and self-preservation without harming others.
Successfully maneuvers his car at the last second to avoid imminent harm, indirectly causing his pursuers to collide without direct aggression from him.
After car crash, climbs out carefully despite injury and runs to safety rather than retaliates aggressively.
Keeps pit bulls at bay to protect crops, uses steering wheel as a weapon despite being cuffed to his hand.

Pulls the Dildozer driver out of the burning vehicle despite being attacked immediately after.
